document.title: National Information Exchange Model Model Package Description Specification
document.author: NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC)

rule.p: Any instance XML document that validates against a NIEM schema document subset will validate against the NIEM reference schema document set from which that schema document subset was derived.

A subset schema document in a schema document subset derived from a reference schema document set MUST bear the same target namespace as the schema document in the reference schema document set on which it is based.

A constraint schema document MUST bear a target namespace that has been previously assigned to a reference or extension schema document, or is a constraint schema document intended to support another constraint schema document that has such a target namespace.
A NIEM-conformant IEPD or EIEM MUST contain at least one schema document that is either a NIEM reference schema document or a subset schema document derived from a NIEM reference schema document.
A well-formed and NIEM IEPD MUST contain an MPD catalog XML document artifact that:

li.p: validates with the NIEM MPD catalog schema contained in .
validates with the NIEM MPD catalog Schematron rules [TBD].
resides in the MPD root directory.
bears the file name mpd-catalog.xml.

rule.p: An MPD extension XML catalog document:

li.p: MUST reside in the same relative directory as the mpd-catalog.xml artifact (normally in the MPD root directory)
MUST bear the file name (and type) mpd-extension-xml-catalog.xml.
MUST resolve all MPD catalog schema extension document namespaces to the correct corresponding local URIs in the MPD.

rule.p: An MPD catalog extension schema document:

li.p: MUST conform to the , specifically the extension schema conformance target rules.
MUST bear the file type of .xsd
MAY have any file name.
MAY reside anywhere within the MPD (the XML catalog MUST resolve its URI).

rule.p: An MPD-catalog-extension-schema-document-data-component:

li.p: MUST conform to the Specification.
MUST conform to the (extension schema document conformance target).
MUST employ XSD type derivation (xs:extension or xs:restriction) and/or element substitution.

rule.p: An MPD MUST be assigned a version number that adheres to the regular expression:
rule.pre: version ::= digit+ ('.' digit+)* (status digit+)? Where: digit ::= [0-9] status ::= 'alpha' | 'beta' | 'rc' | 'rev'

rule.p: MPD version numbers within a version series do NOT imply compatibility between versions. Compatibility between or among MPD versions MUST be explicitly stated in documentation.
An MPD MUST be assigned a valid http URI.
A URI for an MPD MUST end in its version number concatenated with a forward slash character ("/").
A URI reference to an individual MPD artifact from another resource is the concatenation of

li.p: The URI of the MPD that contains the artifact.
The crosshatch or pound character ("#").
A fragment identifier that is the locally unique path name (string) of the artifact relative to the MPD root directory.

rule.p: NIEM namespaces MUST NOT be used as URIs for MPD artifacts.
An MPD that is a reference schema document set (i.e., NIEM releases, core updates, and domain updates) MUST contain an XML change log document that:

li.p: Validates with the NIEM change log schemas mpd-changelog.xsd and niem-model.xsd. (Note these are base filenames; actual filenames also contain a version number; for example, mpd-changelog-1.0.xsd.)
Records changes to previous reference schema documents that this MPD represents.
Bears the file name changelog.xml.
Resides in the MPD root directory.

rule.p: An MPD that is an IEPD or EIEM MUST contain a change log artifact that:

li.p: Records changes to previous IEPD or EIEM schemas that this MPD represents.
Has a file name that begins with the substring "changelog".
Resides in the MPD root directory.

rule.p: The initial version of an IEPD or EIEM MUST contain a change log artifact with at least one entry for its creation date.
If an IEPD or EIEM contains more than one change log artifact, then each change log artifact MUST:

li.p: Have a file name that begins with the substring changelog.
Reside in the MPD root directory.

rule.p: An IEPD or an EIEM MUST contain a master document located in the MPD root directory whose filename begins with the substring master-document.

A NIEM IEPD or EIEM master document SHOULD (at a minimum) describe the MPD purpose, scope, business value, exchange information, typical senders/receivers, interactions, and references to other documentation.
A NIEM IEPD MUST contain a passing NIEM conformance report in its MPD root directory.
An IEPD MUST resolve each namespace it uses to a locally unique URI through one or more XML catalog documents.
A c:IEPConformanceTarget MUST be assigned a locally unique NCName value for its structures:id attribute.
An IEPD MUST explicitly declare all intended validity constraints by employing the c:IEPConformanceTarget element in its MPD catalog document.

An IEPD MUST contain at least one IEP sample XML document instance that exemplifies each declared c:IEPConformanceTarget. If applicable and appropriate, one IEP sample MAY exemplify multiple conformance targets.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute MUST resolve to an MPD artifact.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:XMLCatalog element MUST resolve to an XML catalog document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:MPDChangeLog element MUST resolve to a change log.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:MasterDocument element MUST resolve to a master document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:IEPSampleXMLDocument element MUST resolve to an XML document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:BusinessRulesArtifact element MUST resolve to a business rule schema or business rules artifact.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:ExternalSchemaDocument element MUST resolve to an XML schema document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:ReferenceSchemaDocument element MUST resolve to NIEM reference schema document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:ExtensionSchemaDocument element MUST resolve to a NIEM extension schema document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:SubsetSchemaDocument element MUST resolve to a NIEM subset schema document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:Wantlist element MUST resolve to a NIEM wantlist XML document.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:SchematronSchema element MUST resolve to a Schematron schema.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:RelaxNGSchema element MUST resolve to a RelaxNG schema.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:SchemaDocumentSet element MUST resolve to an XML schema document set.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:ConstraintSchemaDocumentSet element MUST resolve to a NIEM constraint schema document set.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:ReferenceSchemaDocumentSet element MUST resolve to a NIEM reference schema document set.
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:SchematronSchema element MUST resolve to an Schematron schema .
Within the MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:RelaxNGSchema element MUST resolve to an RelaxNG schema .
Within an MPD catalog document the value of a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:RequiredFile element MUST resolve to a file artifact.

Within an MPD catalog document with a c:XPathText attribute owned by a c:ValidToXPath element, a candidate IEP is a valid IEP, ONLY IF the value of c:ValidToXPath applied to the candidate IEP (an XML document) has an effective Boolean value (EBV) equal to true. EBV is defined by 2.4.3 Effective Boolean Value.

Within an MPD catalog document with a c:qualifiedNameList attribute owned by a c:HasDocumentElement element, a candidate IEP is a valid IEP, ONLY IF its XML document element is a member of that list of QNames.

Within an MPD catalog document with a c:pathURI attribute owned by a c:IEPSampleXMLDocument, the artifact resolved by the value of c:pathURI MUST be valid for the validity constraints of the c:IEPConformanceTarget parent of c:IEPSampleXMLDocument.
Within an XML catalog document the value of an er:uri attribute owned by a er:URI element MUST resolve to an XML schema document.

Within an XML catalog document, given an XML schema document resolved by the value of an er:uri attribute owned by a er:URI element, the XML schema document target namespace MUST equal the value of the er:name (a namespace string) attribute owned by the er:URI element.
Within an MPD catalog document the value of a c:externalURI attribute owned by an element that is a c:FileType (or a type derived from it) MUST resolve to a resource.
Within an MPD catalog document the value of a c:resourceURI attribute owned by a c:Relationship element MUST resolve to a resource.

A wantlist MUST be a member of the schema document set directory it is associated with. This means it MUST reside with and at the root of the subdirectory that groups and defines its target schema document set.

An MPD is packaged as a single compressed archive of files that represents a sub-tree of a file system in standard format. This archive MUST preserve and store the logical directory structure intended by its author.
Within an MPD archive, all XSD and XML artifacts MUST be valid against and follow all rules for their respective conformance targets; this includes being well-formed and valid XML Schema documents.
An MPD archive MUST uncompress (unzip) to a one and only one MPD root directory.
An MPD archive file MUST use file name syntax defined by the regular expression:
rule.pre: mpd-filename ::= name '-' version '.' class '.zip' Where: name ::= alphanum ((alphanum | special)* alphanum)? alphanum ::= [a-z0-9] special ::= '.' | '-' | '_' version ::= digit+ ('.' digit+)* (status digit+)? digit ::= [0-9] status ::= 'alpha' | 'beta' | 'rc' | 'rev' class ::= 'rel' | 'cu' | 'du' | 'iepd' | 'eiem'

rule.p: For an MPD, the file name substrings for name, version, and class MUST match exactly the mpd-catalog.xml attribute values for c:mpdName, c:mpdVersionID, and c:mpdClassCode respectively.
When represented on the Internet, an MPD archive SHOULD use the following MIME Type:
rule.pre: application/zip+[class] where [class] is one member from the value set {rel, cu, du, iepd, eiem}.
rule.p: Use of the generic Zip MIME type application/zip is allowed, but discouraged. No other MIME types are allowed when representing MPD archives.

Absolute references to Internet resources MUST use a well-known transfer protocol (http, https, ftp, ftps) and MUST resolve (If applicable, documentation that describes how to resolve with security, account, and/or password issues MUST be included).
A published IEPD MUST contain all documents necessary to understand it and facilitate its correct implementation.
A published IEPD MUST link (through its MPD catalog) to any EIEM it is based on.

Within an MPD, if non-conformant external schema documents are used, then any references from these schema documents to other namespaces MUST resolve to local URIs. xs:schemaLocation attributes or XML catalogs can be used to ensure resolution.

Within any artifact of an MPD archive, any direct reference to another resource (i.e., another artifact such as an image, schema, stylesheet, etc.) that is required to process or display an artifact SHOULD exist within the archive at the location specified by that reference.

definition.p: A set of related W3C XML Schema documents and other supporting files organized as one of the five classes of NIEM schema sets:

li.p: Release (major, minor, or micro).
Domain update (DU) to a release.
Core update (CU) to a release.
Information Exchange Package Documentation (IEPD).
Enterprise Information Exchange Model (EIEM).

definition.p: An MPD is self-documenting and provides sufficient normative and non-normative information to allow technical personnel to understand how to use or implement it. An MPD is packaged as a archive file.
An XML Schema type or attribute group definition; or an XML Schema element or attribute declaration.
A single file with a defined purpose.
A collection of artifacts logically grouped for a defined purpose.

Given a data model, harmonization is the process of reviewing its existing data definitions and declarations; reviewing how it structures and represents data; integrating new data components; and refactoring data components as necessary to remove (or reduce to the maximum extent) semantic duplication and/or semantic overlap among all data structures and definitions resulting in representational quality improvements.
A document in XML format as defined by , 2.
A schema component is as defined by 2.2, XML Schema Abstract Data Model, which states:

blockquote.p: Schema component is the generic term for the building blocks that comprise the abstract data model of the schema.

definition.p: An XML Schema is as defined by 2.2, XML Schema Abstract Data Model, which states:

blockquote.p: An XML Schema is a set of schema components.

definition.p: The process of checking an XML document to confirm that it is both well-formed and valid, in that it follows the structure defined by an associated XML Schema. A well-formed document follows the basic syntactic rules of XML, which are the same for all XML documents.
A physical (file) representation of part or all of an XML Schema. One or more XML schema documents are used to assemble schema components into an XML Schema.
An XML Schema document that meets all of the following criteria:

li.p: It is a conformant schema document.
It is explicitly designated as a reference schema document. This may be declared by an MPD catalog or by a tool-specific mechanism outside the schema document.
It provides the broadest, most fundamental definitions of components in its namespace.
It provides the authoritative definition of business semantics for components in its namespace.
It is intended to serve as the basis for components in IEPD and EIEM schema documents, including subset, constraint, and extension schema documents.

definition.p: See also reference schema document set.
A set of related reference schema documents, such as a NIEM release. See also reference schema document.
The term conformance target is as defined by , which states:

blockquote.p: A conformance target is a class of artifact, such as an interface, protocol, document, platform, process or service, that is the subject of conformance clauses and normative statements. There may be several conformance targets defined within a specification, and these targets may be diverse so as to reflect different aspects of a specification. For example, a protocol message and a protocol engine may be different conformance targets.

definition.p: The term conformance target identifier is as defined by , which states:

blockquote.p: A conformance target identifier is an internationalized resource identifier that uniquely identifies a conformance target.

definition.p: The term effective conformance target identifier is as defined by , which states:

blockquote.p: An effective conformance target identifier of a conformant document is an internationalized resource identifier reference that occurs in the documents effective conformance targets attribute.

definition.p: A reference schema document set published by the NIEM Program Management Office (PMO) at http://release.niem.gov/ and assigned a unique version number. Each schema document in the set defines data components for use in NIEM information exchanges. Each release is independent of other releases, although a schema document may occur in multiple releases. A release is of high quality, and has been vetted by NIEM governance bodies. A numbered release may be a major, minor, or micro release.

A NIEM release in which the NIEM Core reference schema document has changed since previous releases. The first integer of the version number indicates the major release series; for example, versions 1.0, 2.0, and 3.0 are different major releases.

A NIEM release in which the NIEM Core has not changed from previous releases in the series, but at least one or more domain reference schema documents have changed. A second digit greater than zero in the version number indicates a minor release (for example, v2.1). Note also that major v2.0 and minor v2.1 are in the same series (i.e., series 2) and contain the same NIEM Core schema document.

A NIEM release in which neither the NIEM Core nor the domain reference schema documents have changed from the previous major or minor release, but one or more new reference schema documents have been added (without impact to domain or Core schemas). A third digit greater than zero in the version number indicates a micro release (for example, v2.1.1 note that this release does not exist as of this date).

An MPD that contains a reference schema document or document set issued by one or more domains that constitutes new content or an update to content that was previously published in a NIEM release. Domain updates are published to the NIEM Publication Area at http://publication.niem.gov/niem/ and available for immediate use within IEPDs.

An MPD that applies changes to a given NIEM core schema document or document set. A core update never replaces a NIEM core; instead, it is used to add new schema documents, new data components, new code values, etc. to a particular NIEM core. In some cases, a core update can make minor modifications to existing core data components.
An MPD that defines one or more (generally recurring) XML data or information exchanges.
An XML document that satisfies all the validity constraints for its class as defined by a NIEM IEPD.

A group of organizations with business interactions that agree to exchange information, often using multiple types of information exchanges. The member organizations have similar business definitions for objects used in an information exchange and can usually agree on their common BIEC names and definitions.

A NIEM-conformant XML schema data component definition or declaration (for a type, element, attribute, or other XML construct) reused, subsetted, extended, and/or created from NIEM that meets a particular recurring business requirement for an information sharing enterprise.

An MPD that contains a NIEM-conformant schema document set that defines and declares data components to be consistently reused in the IEPDs of an enterprise. An EIEM is a collection of BIECs organized into a schema document subset and one or more extension schema documents. Constraint schema documents and non-NIEM-conformant external standards schema documents with type adapters are optional.
An XML schema document that meets all of the following criteria:

li.p: It is built from a reference schema document set where one or more reference schema documents has been substituted by a its corresponding subset schema document.
It is built from a reference schema document by applying subset operations to the XML schema statements in a reference schema document.
It is explicitly designated as a subset schema document. This is accomplished by declaration in the relevant MPD catalog or by a tool-specific mechanism outside the subset schema document.

It has a target namespace previously defined by a reference schema document. That is, it does not provide original definitions and declarations for schema components, but instead provides an alternate schema representation of components that are defined by a reference schema document.
It does not alter the business semantics of components in its namespace. The reference schema document defines these business semantics.
It is intended to express the limited vocabulary necessary for an IEPD or EIEM and to support XML Schema validation for an IEPD.

definition.p: See also schema document subset.
An XML schema document set built from a reference schema document set by applying subset operations to the reference schema documents in that set. See also subset schema document.
A NIEM-conformant schema document that adds domain or application specific content to the base NIEM model.
Any XML schema document that is not a NIEM-supporting schema and that is not NIEM-conformant.

A schema document that imposes additional constraints on NIEM-conformant instance XML documents. A constraint schema document or document set validates additional constraints imposed on an instance XML document only after it is known to be NIEM-conformant (i.e., has been validated with a reference schema document set, or schema document subset, and applicable extension schema documents). Constraint schema document validation is a second-pass validation process that occurs independently of and after conformance validation. A constraint schema document need not validate constraints that are applied by other schema documents. See also constraint schema document set.
A set of related constraint schema documents that work together, such as a constraint schema document set built by adding constraints to a schema document subset. See also constraint schema document.
An XML document that is Schema valid to mpd-catalog-3.0.xsd in . The MPD catalog document contains metadata that describes:

li.p: Unique identification
Basic characteristics and properties
Key artifacts and directory structure
Relationships to other MPDs and their artifacts

definition.p: A formal (for releases, core updates, domain updates) or informal (for IEPDs and EIEMs) artifact that accounts for changes applied to an MPD since its previous version (or versions).

An informal documentation artifact contained in an IEPD or EIEM that serves as the initial general source of human readable descriptive or instructional information. A master document may index or reference other more specific documentation or other explanatory materials within the MPD.
An XML document defined by the semantics of .
A class or category of IEPs which has a set of one or more validity constraints and a unique identifier. Every IEP is an instance of one or more IEP conformance targets.
A globally unique identifier for an IEP conformance target declared in an IEPD, formed by concatenating:

li.p: the IEPD URI
the pound character (#) and
a locally unique NCName per

definition.p: Satisfies the following criteria:

li.p: Is a valid archive file.
Contains one and only one mpd-catalog.xml artifact.
Its mpd-catalog.xml artifact resides in the MPD root directory.
Its mpd-catalog.xml artifact is XML Schema valid to .
Adheres to the validity rules defined in the Well-Formed-MPD section of this MPD Specification.

definition.p: An function (or action) that takes a URI string of the form xs:anyURI and returns the resource it identifies. If the resource does not exist, then this function fails. If a resource is remote (e.g., a URL on the Internet or a URN of an unknown location), then this function (or action) may require human intervention to complete.
An XML element that refers to its value by a reference attribute instead of carrying it as content
Satisfies the following criteria:

li.p: [TBD]

definition.p: A special kind of MPD that establishes at least one conformance target for a class of IEPs (by employing one or more c:IEPConformanceTarget elements. Furthermore, satisfies all rules and mandatory requirements for:

li.p: (i.e., This MPD Specification)

definition.p: An XML document that represents a complete NIEM schema document subset.
Formal or informal statements that describe business policy or procedure, and in doing so define or constrain some aspect of a process or procedure in order to impose control.
An artifact that contains business rules in a formal representation language with the intent to automatically process them on an XML document to enforce business constraints.
A business rule schema that adheres to .
A business rule schema that adheres to .
The top level file directory relative to all MPD artifacts and subdirectories.

reference.label: FEA Data Reference Model
reference.p: The Federal Enterprise Architecture Data Reference Model, Version 1.0, September 2004. Available from http://xml.gov/documents/completed/DRMv1.pdf. A more recent DRM Version 2.0, 17 November 2005 is available from http://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/assets/egov_docs/DRM_2_0_Final.pdf

reference.label: GJXDM IEPD Guidelines
reference.p: GJXDM Information Exchange Package Documentation Guidelines, Version 1.1, Global XML Structure Task Force (GXSTF), 2 March 2005. Available from http://it.ojp.gov/documents/global_jxdm_IEPD_guidelines_v1_1.pdf

reference.label: ISO 11179-4
reference.p: ISO/IEC 11179-4 Information Technology Metadata Registries (MDR) Part 4: Formulation of Data Definitions Second Edition, 15 July 2004. Available from http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/c035346_ISO_IEC_11179-4_2004(E).zip.

reference.label: ISO 11179-5
reference.p: ISO/IEC 11179-5:2005, Information technology Metadata registries (MDR) Part 5: Naming and identification principles. Available from http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/c035347_ISO_IEC_11179-5_2005(E).zip.

reference.label: ISO RelaxNG
reference.p: Document Schema Definition Language (DSDL) Part 2: Regular-grammar-based validation RELAX NG, ISO/IEC 19757-2:2008, Second Edition, 15 December 2008. Available from http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/c052348_ISO_IEC_19757-2_2008(E).zip. See also http://relaxng.org.

reference.label: ISO Schematron
reference.p: Schema Definition Languages (DSDL) Part 3: Rule-based validation Schematron, ISO/IEC 19757-3:2006(E), First Edition, 1 June 2006. Available from http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/c040833_ISO_IEC_19757-3_2006(E).zip.

reference.label: Logical Entity Exchange Specifications
reference.p: Logical Entity Exchange Specifications, Version 4.0, 27 July 2011. Available from http://130.207.211.107/content/downloads.

reference.label: NIEM BIEC
reference.p: Business Information Exchange Components (BIEC), Version 1.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), March 2011. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/guidance/business-information-exchange-components/1.0/.

reference.label: NIEM Conformance
reference.p: NIEM Conformance, Version 1.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), 15 September 2008. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/conformance/1.0/.

reference.label: NIEM Conformance Target Attribute Specification
reference.p: NIEM Conformance Target Attribute Specification, Version 1.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), 15 January 2013. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/conformance-target-attribute/1.0/.

reference.label: NIEM Concept of Operations
reference.p: NIEM Concept of Operations, Version 0.5, NIEM Program Management Office, 9 January 2007. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/guidance/concept-of-operations/.

reference.label: NIEM Domain Update Specification
reference.p: NIEM Domain Update Specification, Version 1.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), 5 November 2010. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/domain-update/1.0/.

reference.label: NIEM High-Level Tool Architecture
reference.p: NIEM High-Level Tool Architecture, Version 1.1, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee, 1 December 2008. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/high-level-tool-architecture/1.1/.

reference.label: NIEM High-Level Version Architecture
reference.p: NIEM High Level Version Architecture (HLVA), Version 1.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee, 2008. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/high-level-version-architecture/1.0/.

reference.label: NIEM IEPD Requirements
reference.p: Requirements for a National Information Exchange Model (NIEM) Information Exchange Package Documentation (IEPD) Specification, Version 2.1, June 2006. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/guidance/iepd-requirements/2.1/.

reference.label: NIEM Implementation Guidance
reference.p: NIEM Implementation Guide, NIEM Program Management Office. Available from https://www.niem.gov/program-managers/Pages/implementation-guide.aspx.

reference.label: NIEM Introduction
reference.p: Introduction to the National Information Exchange Model (NIEM), Version 0.3, NIEM Program Management Office, 12 February 2007. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/guidance/introduction/.

reference.label: NIEM MPD Specification
reference.p: NIEM Model Package Description (MPD) Specification, Version 3.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), day month [TBD] 2014. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/model-package-description/3.0/.

reference.label: NIEM NDR
reference.p: NIEM Naming and Design Rules (NDR), Version 3.0, NIEM Technical Architecture Committee (NTAC), 31 October 2008. Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/specification/naming-and-design-rules/3.0/.

reference.label: NIEM SSGT
reference.p: NIEM Schema Subset Generation Tool (SSGT). Available from http://tools.niem.gov/niemtools/ssgt/index.iepd.

reference.label: NIEM User Guide
reference.p: NIEM User Guide, Volume 1, U.S. Department of Justice, Office of Justice Programs, (date unknown). Available from http://reference.niem.gov/niem/guidance/user-guide/vol1/.

reference.label: XML Catalogs
reference.p: XML Catalogs, Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS) Standard v1.1, 7 October 2005. Available from https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/download.php/14809/std-entity-xml-catalogs-1.1.html.

reference.label: Principles of Data Integration
reference.p: Principles of Data Integration, AnHai Doan, Alon Halevy, and Xachary Ives, Morgan Kaufmann, 25 June 2012.

reference.label: RFC2119 Key Words
reference.p: Bradner, S., Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels, IETF RFC 2119, March 1997. Available from http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2119.txt.

reference.label: RFC3986 URI
reference.p: Berners-Lee, T., et al., Uniform Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax, Request for Comments 3986, Network Working Group, January 2005. Available from http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986.
Efficient XML Interchange (EXI) Format, Version 1.0, W3C Recommendation, 10 March 2011. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2011/REC-exi-20110310/.
Extensible Markup Language (XML), Version 1.0, Fifth Edition, W3C Recommendation 26 November 2008. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/REC-xml-20081126/.
XML Information Set, Second Edition, W3C Recommendation 4 February 2004. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/REC-xml-infoset-20040204/.
Namespaces in XML, Second Edition, World Wide Web Consortium 16 August 2006. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-names-20060816/.

reference.label: W3C XML Schema Datatypes
reference.p: XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes, Second Edition, W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/REC-xmlschema-2-20041028/.

reference.label: W3C XML Schema Structures
reference.p: XML Schema Part 1: Structures, Second Edition, W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2004/REC-xmlschema-1-20041028/.

reference.label: W3C XPath 2.0
reference.p: XML Path Language (XPath) 2.0, Second Edition, W3C Recommendation 14 December 2010. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/REC-xpath20-20101214/.

reference.label: XSLT v1.0
reference.p: XSL Transformations (XSLT), Version 1.0, W3C Recommendation 16 November 1999. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-xslt-19991116.

reference.label: XSLT v2.0
reference.p: XSL Transformations (XSLT), Version 2.0, W3C Recommendation 23 January 2007. Available from http://www.w3.org/TR/2007/REC-xslt20-20070123/.
